intro: Cybianthus loretensis, commonly known as the Loretto's cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a mix of white and yellow hues. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
